thread.title: Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi spearhead FIFPro World XI as ZERO Premier League players are selected
thread.title_full: Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi spearhead FIFPro World XI as ZERO Premier League players are selected

author: James Whaling
title: Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi spearhead FIFPro World XI as ZERO Premier League players are selected
text:
Sport Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi spearhead FIFPro World XI as ZERO Premier League players are selected All but two of the players selected in the team represent either Real Madrid or Bayern Munich, with only Manuel Neuer and Dani Alves coming from elsewhere Share Messi and Ronaldo spearhead the FIFPro World XI (Photo: Alex Caparros) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The Premier League was snubbed in the FIFPro World XI as ZERO players from England's top flight were selected in the team of the year. 
Clasico rivals Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi spearhead the fantasy side, as expected, with Barcelona striker Luis Suarez completing the forward line. 
In all, nine of the 11 players in the team represent either Barca or Real Madrid at club level, with Manuel Neuer (Bayern Munich) and Dani Alves (Juventus) the only exceptions. 
Atletico Madrid striker Antoine Griezmann, who is nominated for the main individual award, is overlooked. 
Ronaldo is expected to add The Best FIFA Men's Player award to his Ballon d'Or.
